page.title: 20ASHTON MILL 2
page.content: The watermill on the River Nene was converted in 19OO to provide piped water for the village from a 10,000 gallon tank at the end of the mill. Electricity was also generated. This engineering work was done by William Morris Thomas, an employee of the Lord Rothschild who then owned the estate. His daughter, the Hon.Mrs.Lane, is the present owner. The engines for the mill were also made locally by Blackstones of Stamford. The firm still exists in 1985, although like many others it seems to be going through hard times. The mill itself is now preserved as a fish museum and open to the public at weekends. {ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS Many thanks to Ashton Estate and PWS students and staff (Mrs.Bainbridge, Mrs Tate, Mr Cain and Mr.Parker.)
